smtools.application.concurrent

Class AJTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Integer>
      • smtools.application.concurrent.AJTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Void>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JDerivedGUIApplication.MyTask

    public abstract class AJTask
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Integer>
    The AJTask class provides the basic functionality for a task.

    A user must implement the executeSubTask(int) and finishTask() methods. The former is called for each subtask, whereas the latter is called upon completion of all the subtasks.

    Note that this is an abstract class.

    Version:
    02/02/2013
    Author:
    Sven Maerivoet
    See Also:
    JTaskExecutor
